lessons.title: Lesson #4
lessons.interactiveContent:
Ensure fetch will be executed when the component mounts.

Make sure to type [].

lessons.title: Lesson #7 - Copy
lessons.interactiveContent:
What does the following React code using useState and useEffect do?

Fetches a character and displays the statusFetches a character and displays the nameFetches a character and displays the speciesFetches a character and displays nothing

Fetches a character and displays the status.

lessons.title: Lesson #11
lessons.interactiveContent:
Create a state to store an error message and display it when there's a fetch error.

Make sure to pick useState followed by const and then error, setError, useState, null.

lessons.title: Lesson #5
lessons.interactiveContent:
Fetch some data from an API using async and await.

Make sure to pick const followed by response and then =, await, fetch.

lessons.title: Lesson #5
lessons.interactiveContent:
Set up a new component to read and display a query parameter named "mood".

Make sure to pick useLocation followed by URLSearchParams and then location, ., search.

lessons.title: Lesson #6
lessons.interactiveContent:
What element defines a path and component to render when the path matches in react-router-dom?

<Route><NavLink><Switch><Link>

Make sure to pick <Route>.

lessons.title: Lesson #7
lessons.interactiveContent:
Complete the code to enable routing.

Make sure to type BrowserRouter.

lessons.title: Lesson #6
lessons.interactiveContent:
What attribute can be used in the Link component to ensure the right path is used?

reftoidtarget

Make sure to pick to.

lessons.title: Lesson #6
lessons.interactiveContent:
Examine the following code and identify what location.pathname will show.

//home/dashboard/profile

Make sure to pick /.

lessons.title: Lesson #5
lessons.interactiveContent:
Complete the code to invoke fetch on button click and handle the response correctly.

Make sure to pick response followed by response.json() and then data, setData(data).

lessons.title: Lesson #9
lessons.interactiveContent:
Implement a fetching, setting the data in case of success and setting the error in case of failure.

Make sure to pick setData followed by data and then setError, error.

lessons.title: Lesson #12
lessons.interactiveContent:
Why is useEffect commonly used with fetch requests?

To perform data fetching after the component mountsTo fetch data synchronously before renderingTo avoid using async/awaitTo create infinite loops by running on every render

To perform data fetching after the component mounts.

lessons.title: Lesson #6
lessons.interactiveContent:
In an async and await function, where should you put code lines that might throw an error?

Inside a try blockInside a finally blockAt the beginning of the functionAfter the catch block

Inside a try block.

lessons.title: Lesson #6
lessons.interactiveContent:
What will the snippet below display if the URL is https://my-react-app.com?day=friday?

It's clear todayIt's friday todayIt's undefined todayIt's weather today

It's clear today.

lessons.title: Lesson #8
lessons.interactiveContent:
When defining nested routes, which component is typically used to display child components?

RouteLinkRedirectNavLink

Make sure to pick Route.

lessons.title: Lesson #4
lessons.interactiveContent:
Which React component is used to render links between components?

RouterRouteLinkNavLink

Make sure to pick Link.

lessons.title: Lesson #5
lessons.interactiveContent:
Use the useNavigate hook to navigate programmatically when the function goToProfilePage is executed.

Make sure to type navigate.

lessons.title: Lesson #6
lessons.interactiveContent:
When should you use the fetch function to retrieve data?

When you need data from an APIWhen you want to format stringsWhen you want to render a componentWhen you need to update a state variable

When you need data from an API.

lessons.title: Lesson #9 - Copy
lessons.interactiveContent:
In the App component, which part is responsible for logging an error?

The catch blockThe fetch callThe try blockNo error is logged

The catch block.

lessons.title: Lesson #7
lessons.interactiveContent:
Throw a custom error.

Make sure to pick throw followed by new and then Error, "Failed to fetch move.".

lessons.title: Lesson #8
lessons.interactiveContent:
How would you modify a fetch request to throw your own error if the response status is not ok?

Check if (!response.ok) { throw new Error("Custom error"); }By using response.throw("Custom error");Logging the error using console.log("Custom error");Adding a finally block

Check if (!response.ok) { throw new Error("Custom error"); }.

lessons.title: Lesson #7
lessons.interactiveContent:
Create a React component to extract and display a query parameter called "character".

Make sure to pick character followed by query.get and then "character", character.

lessons.title: Lesson #8
lessons.interactiveContent:
In the code snippet below, if the URL is https://my-react-app.com?movie=titanic, what does {filmTitle || "No Selection"} display?

No Selectiontitanicmoviedirector

No Selection.

lessons.title: Lesson #9
lessons.interactiveContent:
Finish the code to enable two different routes with two different components.

Make sure to pick Route followed by element and then <Home />, path, "/contact".

lessons.title: Lesson #5
lessons.interactiveContent:
Add the link to the about page.

Make sure to type Link.

lessons.title: Lesson #4
lessons.interactiveContent:
What does the useLocation hook return?

An object with location details, such as pathnameA string with the current URLAn array of previous locationsA function to navigate to different routes

An object with location details, such as pathname.
